pageContext.description: Sides show 3 facets.,  Corners of edge blunted. Otherwise perfect.
pageContext.surface: Metallic with spots of green corrosion, slight on one face, numerous on the other.
pageContext.associations: Part of a hoard consisting of 16 flanged celts. 3 daggers. a spearhead + a chisel.
pageContext.publications: Evans. Ancient Bronze Implements 50. 51. 165. 241. 259. 464.,  Arch. Journ. XXVI. 346. where the scale given is erroneous.
pageContext.collection: British Museum 69 12 2 20,  Given by the Duke of Bedford 1869
pageContext.site: England, Devon, Plymstock, about a mile east of Preston, beneath a flat stone at a depth of 2 feet.
pageContext.toSearch: Plymstock, Plymouth, Plymouth, Plymouth Pl9, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: On display (+ 1 chisel) in Exeter. 4 axes
